intro: Anonis scariosa, commonly known as the scarious anona, is a tropical plant native to regions of South America. It is a shrub or small tree that can grow up to 6 meters in height, featuring palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by fruit that resembles a green, fleshy berry. Its botanical characteristics include a woody stem, hairy surfaces on young leaves, and a distinctive scent. Anonis scariosa is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests.
